intro: Dracophyllum urvilleanum, commonly known as the Urville’s dracophyllum, is a shrub belonging to the Ericaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in Argentina and Chile. The plant features small, leathery leaves and produces clusters of bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in high-altitude environments. Dracophyllum urvilleanum is notable for its ability to withstand harsh climatic conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
